intro: Diplotaxis catholica subsp. eu-catholica, commonly known as the African wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is an annual or biennial herb with erect, branching stems and hairy foliage. The plant produces yellow or orange flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from spring to summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a distinctive waxy coating. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields.
